 3 require 'test/unit'
 4 require 'icalendar'
 5 
 6 require 'date'
 7 
 8 require 'rubygems'
 9 require 'breakpoint'
10 
11 class TestCalendar < Test::Unit::TestCase
12    # Generate a calendar using the raw api, and then spit it out
13    # as a string.  Parse the string and make sure everything matches up.
14    def test_raw_generation    
15       # Create a fresh calendar
16       cal = Icalendar::Calendar.new
17 
18       cal.calscale = "GREGORIAN"
19       cal.version = "3.2"
20       cal.prodid = "test-prodid"
21 
22       # Now generate the string and then parse it so we can verify 
23       # that everything was set, generated and parsed correctly.
24       calString = cal.to_ical
25 
26       cals = Icalendar::Parser.new(calString).parse
27 
28       cal2 = cals.first
29       assert_equal("GREGORIAN", cal2.calscale)
30       assert_equal("3.2", cal2.version)
31       assert_equal("test-prodid", cal2.prodid)
32    end
33 
34    def test_block_creation
35       cal = Icalendar::Calendar.new
36       cal.event do
37          self.dtend = "19970903T190000Z"
38          self.summary = "This is my summary"
39       end
40 
41       event = cal.event
42       event.dtend "19970903T190000Z", {:TZID => "Europe/Copenhagen"}
43       event.summary "This is my summary"
44 
45       ev = cal.events.each do |ev|
46          assert_equal("19970903T190000Z", ev.dtend)
47          assert_equal("This is my summary", ev.summary)
48       end
49    end
50 end
